在老挝，我与几位当地人共事，他们慷慨地给予我时间和信任，由于该国法律禁止合法新闻报道，其中大多数人的名字都不能透露。其中一位允许我向他表示感谢的人是 Sengphouxay “Seng” Inthavikham，他带我穿越偏远的老挝-中国边境地区，帮助我赢得了在那里遇到的人们的信任。来自昆明、在磨丁工作的年轻人 Callan Cheng 就是其中之一，我很欣赏他愿意让一个完全陌生的人闯入他的日常生活。

In Laos, I worked with several locals who were generous with their time and trust, most of whom cannot be named here due to that country’s laws against legitimate journalism. One who did give me permission to thank him is Sengphouxay “Seng” Inthavikham, who guided me through the remote Lao-China border region and helped me earn the trust of the people I met there. Callan Cheng, the young man from Kunming working in Boten, was one of those people, and I appreciate his willingness to let a perfect stranger intrude on his daily life.

在新加坡，我要感谢百老汇玛利安的 Ed Baker 和 Dan Gerrella、世界银行的 Jordan Schwartz 以及作家 Parag Khanna。ISEAS 的研究人员耐心地向我介绍了新加坡城市规划的怪异之处。Lucas Yong 是我在马来西亚的“公寓买家”，他是一位令人愉快的帮手。

In Singapore, I owe debts of gratitude to Ed Baker and Dan Gerrella at Broadway Malyan, Jordan Schwartz at the World Bank, and author Parag Khanna. The research staff at ISEAS patiently walked me through the eccentricities of Singaporean urban planning. Lucas Yong was a delightful accomplice as my fellow “condo buyer” in Malaysia.

在仰光和清迈， 缅甸民主之声的记者和编辑们 非常友好，允许我在新闻编辑室里闲逛，并在他们努力赶上截止期限时打断他们提问。在曼谷，Sipat Vongsakul 是一位宝贵的翻译、调解人和朋友，他为这个项目贡献的时间累计可能比我和我的编辑以外的任何人都多。

In Yangon and Chiang Mai, the reporters and editors at Democratic Voice of Burma were kind enough to let me wander the newsroom and interrupt them with questions as they worked to meet their deadlines. In Bangkok, Sipat Vongsakul was an invaluable translator, fixer, and friend, and contributed more cumulative hours to this project than perhaps anyone other than me and my editor.

Agatha Kratz 几乎研究过泛亚铁路的各个方面，她通读了本书的草稿；她的反馈、修改和鼓励改变了最终成品。许多其他读者也审阅了早期草稿的部分内容，从而对各个章节和整体前提进行了实质性的改进。这些人包括 David Roberts、Brian Eyler、Frank Albert、Vicky Bowman、Termsak Chalermpalanupap、Cassey Lee、Simon Creak 和 Mary Kay Magistad。

Agatha Kratz, who has studied virtually every aspect of the Pan-Asia Railway, read drafts of this book in its entirety; her feedback, corrections, and encouragement transformed the final product. Many other readers reviewed sections of early drafts as well, which led to substantive improvements to both individual chapters and the overall premise. Those people are David Roberts, Brian Eyler, Frank Albert, Vicky Bowman, Termsak Chalermpalanupap, Cassey Lee, Simon Creak, and Mary Kay Magistad.

最后，感谢我的父母和家人一直以来的支持，特别是汤姆·穆尔肯，他从我小时候就开始鼓励我成为一名记者。最重要的是，感谢我亲爱的搭档和高效的队友本·唐纳，他对这类项目有着无限的热情。

Finally, thank you to my parents and family for always being supportive, particularly Tom Mulkern, Sr., who started encouraging me to become a journalist from the time I was a child. And most of all, to my loving partner and effective teammate Ben Donner, for his limitless enthusiasm for projects like these.

进一步阅读

FURTHER READING

塞巴斯蒂安·斯特兰吉奥， 《洪森的柬埔寨》 （耶鲁大学出版社，2014 年）。塞巴斯蒂安·斯特兰吉奥的传记深入浅出地描述了一位职业独裁者及其疯狂的中国附庸国，是东南亚政治的典型案例。这也是老挝的警示，老挝和柬埔寨一样，面临着被中国债务吞噬的风险。这不仅仅是一部传记，更是对该地区发展过程中贪得无厌的暴利行为的详尽控诉。

Sebastian Strangio, Hun Sen’s Cambodia (Yale University Press, 2014). Sebastian Strangio’s immersive biography of a career dictator and his crackpot Chinese client state is a case study in gonzo Southeast Asian politics. It’s also a cautionary tale for Laos, which, like Cambodia, risks becoming consumed by Chinese debt. More than a biography, it’s an exhaustive indictment of the cynical profiteering that defines so much development in this region of the world.

埃文·奥斯诺斯， 《野心时代：在新中国追逐财富、真相和信仰》 （Farrar, Straus and Giroux，2014 年）。埃文·奥斯诺斯几乎不需要我的推荐。他是当今中国读者最多、可读性最强的作家之一。《 野心时代》借鉴了他过去为 《纽约客》撰写的一些报道， 揭示了这个国家与世界其他国家一样，对其突然崛起措手不及的兴奋和焦虑。

Evan Osnos, Age of Ambition: Chasing Fortune, Truth, and Faith in the New China (Farrar, Straus and Giroux, 2014). Evan Osnos hardly needs a recommendation from me. He’s one of the most read—and most readable—voices writing about China today. Age of Ambition, which draws on some of his past reporting for The New Yorker, teases out the exuberance and anxiety of a country that seems just as caught off guard by its sudden ascent as the rest of the world.

Leslie T. Chang， 《工厂女孩：从乡村到城市，改变中的中国》 （Spiegel & Grau，2008 年）。中国崛起的力量是通过大量流动劳动力的辛勤劳动培育起来的。Leslie T. Chang 讲述了这支流动工人大军中几位年轻女性的生活，这些经历往往令人痛心。她们的故事揭示了个人必须做出的各种牺牲，才能实现自己的抱负，以及社会的抱负。

Leslie T. Chang, Factory Girls: From Village to City in a Changing China (Spiegel & Grau, 2008). China’s rising power has been cultivated through the sweat of a massive migrant labor force. Leslie T. Chang provides an often harrowing account of the lives of a few of the young women who serve in this army of itinerant workers. Their stories reveal the range of sacrifices individuals must make in order to achieve not only their own ambitions, but those of their society.

奥维尔·谢尔和约翰·德勒里， 《财富与权力：中国迈向二十一世纪的长征》 （兰登书屋，2013 年）。中国为何崛起成为世界超级大国？约翰·德勒里和奥维尔·谢尔在回答这个问题的过程中，记录了中国数百年来对 富强的追求：财富和权力。通过深入回顾过去，我们可以从更广阔的视角来审视中国的发展轨迹，让其当前的权力崛起看起来几乎是命中注定的。

Orville Schell and John Delury, Wealth and Power: China’s Long March to the Twenty-first Century (Random House, 2013). Why did China rise to become a world superpower? To the extent this question can be answered, John Delury and Orville Schell chronicle China’s centuries-long pursuit of fuqiang: wealth and power. By reaching deep into the past, a wide-angle view of China’s trajectory emerges, making its current surge in power seem practically predestined.

保罗·索鲁， 《大铁路集市：乘火车穿越亚洲 》（霍顿·米夫林出版社，1975 年）。四十年前，世界上最古怪的旅行者乘坐一系列火车穿越亚洲，而今天，大多数铁路系统同样破旧不堪，甚至更糟。但索鲁的记述最引人注目的是，自那时以来，东南亚一些乡村除了蓬勃发展的大城市之外几乎没有发展，而中国的存在可能会在未来几年改变这种情况。

Paul Theroux, The Great Railway Bazaar: By Train Through Asia (Houghton Mifflin, 1975). Four decades ago the world’s crankiest traveler took a series of trains through Asia, and today, most of those rail systems are just as decrepit, or worse. But what’s most striking about Theroux’s account is how little some parts of the Southeast Asian countryside outside of its booming major cities have developed since then, which China’s presence may change in the coming years.

Sinica 和 Ear to Asia播客。Sinica 和Ear to Asia分别由SupChina和墨尔本大学亚洲研究所制作， 以播客形式提供明智、易懂的见解。Sinica是两者中更不拘一格的——它由一位自称是中国第一支重金属乐队成员的人共同主持。

Sinica and Ear to Asia podcasts. Produced by SupChina and the University of Melbourne’s Asia Institute, respectively, Sinica and Ear to Asia provide smart, digestible insights in podcast form. Sinica is the more irreverent of the two—it’s co-hosted by a self-described member of China’s first heavy metal band.

余华， 《十个词里的中国 》（Anchor Books，2012 年）。余华的著作在中国被禁，但他对文化大革命期间成长经历的描述令人着迷。从一个对其他事情一无所知的孩子的眼光来看，毛泽东的疯狂统治几乎是正常的。

Yu Hua, China in Ten Words (Anchor Books, 2012). Banned in China, Yu Hua’s account of his upbringing during the Cultural Revolution is mesmerizing. Viewed through the eyes of a child who has known nothing else, Mao Zedong’s maniacal reign seems almost normal.

迈克·戴维斯， 《石英之城：挖掘洛杉矶的未来》 （Verso，1990 年）。这本书深入探讨了 20 世纪 80 年代洛杉矶的贫民窟、小型购物中心和封闭式社区，其中充斥着日本的影子，而大多数人（包括作者）都认为，现在这个国家应该已经拥有了加州的大部分地区。书中几乎没有提到中国，这也是我将其列入这份名单的原因——作为当时世界朝一个方向看，而未来却从另一个方向悄悄逼近的时代产物。

Mike Davis, City of Quartz: Excavating the Future in Los Angeles (Verso, 1990). This deep dive into the slums, mini-malls, and gated communities of 1980s Los Angeles is awash with the presence of Japan, a country most people (the author included) assumed would own much of California by now. China is barely mentioned in its pages, which is why I include it on this list—as an artifact of a moment when the world was looking in one direction while the future crept in from another.

哥伦比亚全球报道 是哥伦比亚大学的一个出版机构，它委托作者就全球范围内的各种问题进行原创现场报道。由此产生的中篇小说长度的书籍提供了观察和理解世界的新方式，可以在几个小时内读完。大多数读者都很好奇而且很忙。我们的书就是为他们准备的。

Columbia Global Reports is a publishing imprint from Columbia University that commissions authors to do original onsite reporting around the globe on a wide range of issues. The resulting novella-length books offer new ways to look at and understand the world that can be read in a few hours. Most readers are curious and busy. Our books are for them.
